SAN 001 - MONITOR CODE CORRECTED - 'T' IN SF4 DELETED

bib_record.title: -CORE POLARIZATION IN THE 203 KEV P-1/2-WAVE NEUTRON RESONANCE CAPTURE BY S-32.

free_txt: THE 3.2 MV PELLETRON ACCELERATOR AT THE TOKYO
INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY. THE MACHINE IS PULSED WITH A
PULSE WIDTH OF 1.5 NS FWHM AND A REPETITION RATE OF
2 MHZ. THE AVERAGE BEAM CURRENT WAS 10 MICROAMPS.
.CORRECTIONS WERE APPLIED FOR NEUTRON SELF-SHIELDING
AND NEUTRON MULTIPLE SCATTERING IN THE SAMPLES.
A 102 MM DIAMETER BY 6.4 MM THICK LI-6 GLASS
SCINTILLATOR, LOCATED AT 3 M FROM THE NEUTRON SOURCE
AND IN THE PROTON BEAM DIRECTION, WAS USED TO MEASURE
THE INCIDENT NEUTRON SPECTRUM. THE ENERGY DEPENDENCE
OF THE DETECTOR EFFICIENCY WAS CALCULATED USING A
MONTE CARLO METHOD.
A SECOND LI-6 GLASS DETECTOR, LOCATED AT AN
ANGLE OF 45 DEGREES TO THE PROTON BEAM DIRECTION, WAS
USED TO MONITOR THE NUMBER OF NEUTRONS EMITTED FROM
THE SOURCE.
CAPTURE GAMMA-RAYS WERE DETECTED WITH A NAI-TL
DETECTOR, 76 MM IN DIAMETER BY 152 MM LONG, CENTERED
IN A 254 MM DIAMETER BY 280 MM LONG NAI-TL HOLLOW
ANTI-COMPTON DETECTOR, SURROUNDED BY A HEAVY SHIELD.
THE DETECTOR WAS PLACED AT 80 CM FROM THE SAMPLE AND
AT 125 DEGREES TO THE PROTON BEAM DIRECTION. A LI-6-
HYDRIDE SHIELD WAS INSERTED IN THE COLLIMATOR. THE
RESPONSE FUNCTION OF THE DETECTOR WAS DETERMINED WITH
THE AID OF CALIBRATED RADIOACTIVE SOURCES, AN AM-BE
NEUTRON SOURCE AND A FEW NUCLEAR REACTIONS. THE OVER-
ALL TIME RESOLUTION FOR GAMMA-RAYS ABOVE 0.5 MEV WAS
3.8 NS FWHM.
THE ERRORS GIVEN CONTAIN THE STAT. ERROR,
THE ERROR OF THE GAMMA-RAY SPECTROMETER EFFICIENCY,
THE ERROR OF THE TOTAL CAPTURE YIELD OF GOLD, AND THE
ERROR OF THE STANDARD CAPTURE CROSS SECTION OF AU-197.
THE 3.2 MV PELLETRON ACCELERATOR AT THE TOKYO
INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY. THE MACHINE IS PULSED WITH A
PULSE WIDTH OF 1.5 NS FWHM AND A REPETITION RATE OF
2 MHZ. THE AVERAGE BEAM CURRENT WAS 10 MICROAMPS.
KEV NEUTRONS WERE PRODUCED BY BOMBARDING A
LITHIUM-EVAPORATED COPPER DISK WITH PROTONS FROM THE
PELLETRON. THE COPPER DISK WAS COOLED BY SPRAYING
WATER FROM THE OUTSIDE.
.THE NEUTRON SPECTRUM WAS MEASURED BY TIME-OF-FLIGHT,
USING A LI-6 GLASS DETECTOR.
IN-BEAM GAMMA-RAY SPECTROSCOPY.
NEUTRON-GAMMA SEPARATION WAS OBTAINED WITH
TIME-OF-FLIGHT TECHNIQUES.
THE STANDARD AU-197
CAPTURE CROSS SECTION FROM ENDF/B-V WAS USED.
.THE TARGET CONSISTED OF A NATURAL SULFUR DISK WITH A
WEIGHT OF 57 GRAMS AND HAVING A DIAMETER OF 58 MM AND
A THICKNESS OF 11 MM. THE THICKNESS ALLOWED A NEUTRON
TRANSMISSION OF ABOUT 70 PERCENT AT THE RESONANCE.
.THE ABSOLUTE NUMBER OF SOURCE NEUTRONS WERE DETERMINED
USING A GOLD SAMPLE.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
THE VALUE GIVEN AT 4.0 MEV IS THE SUM FOR THE 3.93
AND 4.05 LEVELS.
.DATA TAKEN FROM TABLE 2 OF MAIN REF.
